intro: Brachyscome nova-anglica, commonly known as the New England daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a central yellow disk. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 cm and produces clusters of flowers from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Brachyscome nova-anglica is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its delicate appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
